programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
NCIS: New Orleans
Agenci NCIS: Nowy Orlean
NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc:
NCIS: New Orleans: Created by Gary Glasberg. With Scott Bakula, Rob Kerkovich, CCH Pounder, Daryl Mitchell. Follows an NCIS team that investigates criminal cases involving military personnel in The Big Easy, a city known for its music, entertainment, and decadence." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt3560084/","name":"NCIS: New Orleans","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM3OTk1NTQyNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjU4NDQwMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Follows an NCIS team that investigates criminal cases involving military personnel in The Big Easy, a city known for its music, entertainment, and decadence.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3560084/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"elainecalloway216"},"dateCreated":"2014-04-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Might be a good spin off","reviewBody":"I grew up in New Orleans and I'm an avid NCIS fan, so I was interested to see how they would handle the Crescent City episodes. Overall, I think it did really well. 8 points out of 10.

A few things: 1. In episode 1, there were a few mistakes that those people who are locals could easily notice. A little bit more research would've been better, but the plot/characters/etc. was good.

2. Bakula's ongoing "my brother, my brother" is too much. People in NOLA don't do that, if anything they say "cher" as an affectionate term for friend, so it seemed overdone on the show.

3. A little bit hard to believe in part 2, that a woman would leave a bar to walk in a dark alley alone with someone she had just met. No local would ever do that. 

4. I liked part 2 much more than part 1, because they focused more on places the locals go to and not just the "tourist top 10 spots" like in episode 1. I also loved how they talked about the city and it gets into your DNA. Great and well scripted.

5. Love the actors and think it could be a great series going forward :)","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":16860,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2014-09-23","keywords":"usa,united states,investigation,naval officer,u.s. navy","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000836/","name":"Scott Bakula"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1827376/","name":"Rob Kerkovich"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001634/","name":"CCH Pounder"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0373192/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0113138/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0274041/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0321782/","name":"Gary Glasberg"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"NCIS: New Orleans: The Fourth Season","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1485290009","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzNkZDYwZjEtMWNlZi00Zjg5LWJhYjktYmY0NzY0ODM2NjM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzNkZDYwZjEtMWNlZi00Zjg5LWJhYjktYmY0NzY0ODM2NjM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Promo"}}</script><metacontent="

programme.review:
IMDb data; ttnr: 3560084, Title: NCIS: New Orleans, --- Description: NCIS: New Orleans: Created by Gary Glasberg. With Scott Bakula, Rob Kerkovich, CCH Pounder, Daryl Mitchell. Follows an NCIS team that investigates criminal cases involving military personnel in The Big Easy, a city known for its music, entertainment, and decadence." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt3560084/","name":"NCIS: New Orleans","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM3OTk1NTQyNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjU4NDQwMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Follows an NCIS team that investigates criminal cases involving military personnel in The Big Easy, a city known for its music, entertainment, and decadence.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3560084/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"elainecalloway216","dateCreated":"2014-04-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Might be a good spin off","reviewBody":"I grew up in New Orleans and I'm an avid NCIS fan, so I was interested to see how they would handle the Crescent City episodes. Overall, I think it did really well. 8 points out of 10.

A few things: 1. In episode 1, there were a few mistakes that those people who are locals could easily notice. A little bit more research would've been better, but the plot/characters/etc. was good.

2. Bakula's ongoing "my brother, my brother" is too much. People in NOLA don't do that, if anything they say "cher" as an affectionate term for friend, so it seemed overdone on the show.

3. A little bit hard to believe in part 2, that a woman would leave a bar to walk in a dark alley alone with someone she had just met. No local would ever do that. 

4. I liked part 2 much more than part 1, because they focused more on places the locals go to and not just the "tourist top 10 spots" like in episode 1. I also loved how they talked about the city and it gets into your DNA. Great and well scripted.

5. Love the actors and think it could be a great series going forward :)","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":16860,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2014-09-23","keywords":"usa,united states,investigation,naval officer,u.s. navy","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000836/","name":"Scott Bakula","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1827376/","name":"Rob Kerkovich","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001634/","name":"CCH Pounder"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0373192/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0113138/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0274041/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0321782/","name":"Gary Glasberg"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"NCIS: New Orleans: The Fourth Season","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1485290009","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzNkZDYwZjEtMWNlZi00Zjg5LWJhYjktYmY0NzY0ODM2NjM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzNkZDYwZjEtMWNlZi00Zjg5LWJhYjktYmY0NzY0ODM2NjM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Promo"</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 3560084, Title: NCIS: New Orleans, --- Description: NCIS: New Orleans: Created by Gary Glasberg. With Scott Bakula, Rob Kerkovich, CCH Pounder, Daryl Mitchell. Follows an NCIS team that investigates criminal cases involving military personnel in The Big Easy, a city known for its music, entertainment, and decadence." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt3560084/","name":"NCIS: New Orleans","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM3OTk1NTQyNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjU4NDQwMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Follows an NCIS team that investigates criminal cases involving military personnel in The Big Easy, a city known for its music, entertainment, and decadence.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3560084/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"elainecalloway216","dateCreated":"2014-04-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Might be a good spin off","reviewBody":"I grew up in New Orleans and I'm an avid NCIS fan, so I was interested to see how they would handle the Crescent City episodes. Overall, I think it did really well. 8 points out of 10.

A few things: 1. In episode 1, there were a few mistakes that those people who are locals could easily notice. A little bit more research would've been better, but the plot/characters/etc. was good.

2. Bakula's ongoing "my brother, my brother" is too much. People in NOLA don't do that, if anything they say "cher" as an affectionate term for friend, so it seemed overdone on the show.

3. A little bit hard to believe in part 2, that a woman would leave a bar to walk in a dark alley alone with someone she had just met. No local would ever do that. 

4. I liked part 2 much more than part 1, because they focused more on places the locals go to and not just the "tourist top 10 spots" like in episode 1. I also loved how they talked about the city and it gets into your DNA. Great and well scripted.

5. Love the actors and think it could be a great series going forward :)","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":16860,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2014-09-23","keywords":"usa,united states,investigation,naval officer,u.s. navy","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000836/","name":"Scott Bakula","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1827376/","name":"Rob Kerkovich","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001634/","name":"CCH Pounder"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0373192/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0113138/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0274041/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0321782/","name":"Gary Glasberg"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"NCIS: New Orleans: The Fourth Season","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1485290009","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzNkZDYwZjEtMWNlZi00Zjg5LWJhYjktYmY0NzY0ODM2NjM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzNkZDYwZjEtMWNlZi00Zjg5LWJhYjktYmY0NzY0ODM2NjM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Promo"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
NCIS: New Orleans
Agenci NCIS: Nowy Orlean
NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc:
NCIS: New Orleans: Created by Gary Glasberg. With Scott Bakula, Rob Kerkovich, CCH Pounder, Daryl Mitchell. Follows an NCIS team that investigates criminal cases involving military personnel in The Big Easy, a city known for its music, entertainment, and decadence." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt3560084/","name":"NCIS: New Orleans","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM3OTk1NTQyNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjU4NDQwMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Follows an NCIS team that investigates criminal cases involving military personnel in The Big Easy, a city known for its music, entertainment, and decadence.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3560084/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"elainecalloway216"},"dateCreated":"2014-04-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Might be a good spin off","reviewBody":"I grew up in New Orleans and I'm an avid NCIS fan, so I was interested to see how they would handle the Crescent City episodes. Overall, I think it did really well. 8 points out of 10.

A few things: 1. In episode 1, there were a few mistakes that those people who are locals could easily notice. A little bit more research would've been better, but the plot/characters/etc. was good.

2. Bakula's ongoing "my brother, my brother" is too much. People in NOLA don't do that, if anything they say "cher" as an affectionate term for friend, so it seemed overdone on the show.

3. A little bit hard to believe in part 2, that a woman would leave a bar to walk in a dark alley alone with someone she had just met. No local would ever do that. 

4. I liked part 2 much more than part 1, because they focused more on places the locals go to and not just the "tourist top 10 spots" like in episode 1. I also loved how they talked about the city and it gets into your DNA. Great and well scripted.

5. Love the actors and think it could be a great series going forward :)","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":16860,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2014-09-23","keywords":"usa,united states,investigation,naval officer,u.s. navy","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000836/","name":"Scott Bakula"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1827376/","name":"Rob Kerkovich"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001634/","name":"CCH Pounder"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0373192/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0113138/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0274041/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0321782/","name":"Gary Glasberg"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"NCIS: New Orleans: The Fourth Season","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1485290009","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzNkZDYwZjEtMWNlZi00Zjg5LWJhYjktYmY0NzY0ODM2NjM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzNkZDYwZjEtMWNlZi00Zjg5LWJhYjktYmY0NzY0ODM2NjM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Promo"}}</script><metacontent="

Follows an NCIS team that investigates criminal cases involving military personnel in The Big Easy, a city known for its music, entertainment, and decadence." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt3560084/","name":"NCIS: New Orleans","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM3OTk1NTQyNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjU4NDQwMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Follows an NCIS team that investigates criminal cases involving military personnel in The Big Easy, a city known for its music, entertainment, and decadence.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3560084/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"elainecalloway216","dateCreated":"2014-04-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Might be a good spin off","reviewBody":"I grew up in New Orleans and I'm an avid NCIS fan, so I was interested to see how they would handle the Crescent City episodes. Overall, I think it did really well. 8 points out of 10.

A few things: 1. In episode 1, there were a few mistakes that those people who are locals could easily notice. A little bit more research would've been better, but the plot/characters/etc. was good.

2. Bakula's ongoing "my brother, my brother" is too much. People in NOLA don't do that, if anything they say "cher" as an affectionate term for friend, so it seemed overdone on the show.

3. A little bit hard to believe in part 2, that a woman would leave a bar to walk in a dark alley alone with someone she had just met. No local would ever do that. 

4. I liked part 2 much more than part 1, because they focused more on places the locals go to and not just the "tourist top 10 spots" like in episode 1. I also loved how they talked about the city and it gets into your DNA. Great and well scripted.

5. IMDb data; ttnr: 3560084, Title: NCIS: New Orleans, --- Description: NCIS: New Orleans: Created by Gary Glasberg. With Scott Bakula, Rob Kerkovich, CCH Pounder, Daryl Mitchell. Follows an NCIS team that investigates criminal cases involving military personnel in The Big Easy, a city known for its music, entertainment, and decadence." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt3560084/","name":"NCIS: New Orleans","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM3OTk1NTQyNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjU4NDQwMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Follows an NCIS team that investigates criminal cases involving military personnel in The Big Easy, a city known for its music, entertainment, and decadence.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3560084/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"elainecalloway216","dateCreated":"2014-04-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Might be a good spin off","reviewBody":"I grew up in New Orleans and I'm an avid NCIS fan, so I was interested to see how they would handle the Crescent City episodes. Overall, I think it did really well. 8 points out of 10.

A few things: 1. In episode 1, there were a few mistakes that those people who are locals could easily notice. A little bit more research would've been better, but the plot/characters/etc. was good.

2. Bakula's ongoing "my brother, my brother" is too much. People in NOLA don't do that, if anything they say "cher" as an affectionate term for friend, so it seemed overdone on the show.

3. A little bit hard to believe in part 2, that a woman would leave a bar to walk in a dark alley alone with someone she had just met. No local would ever do that. 

4. I liked part 2 much more than part 1, because they focused more on places the locals go to and not just the "tourist top 10 spots" like in episode 1. I also loved how they talked about the city and it gets into your DNA. Great and well scripted.

5. Love the actors and think it could be a great series going forward :)","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":16860,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2014-09-23","keywords":"usa,united states,investigation,naval officer,u.s. navy","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000836/","name":"Scott Bakula","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1827376/","name":"Rob Kerkovich","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001634/","name":"CCH Pounder"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0373192/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0113138/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0274041/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0321782/","name":"Gary Glasberg"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"NCIS: New Orleans: The Fourth Season","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1485290009","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzNkZDYwZjEtMWNlZi00Zjg5LWJhYjktYmY0NzY0ODM2NjM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzNkZDYwZjEtMWNlZi00Zjg5LWJhYjktYmY0NzY0ODM2NjM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Promo"</script><metacontent="

programme.review: IMDb data; ttnr: 10108664, Title: The Disappearance of Susan Cox Powell, --- Description: The Disappearance of Susan Cox Powell: With Stephanie Bauer, Jennifer Graves, Josh Skurnik, Kirk Graves. programme.desc:
NCIS: New Orleans: Created by Gary Glasberg. With Scott Bakula, Rob Kerkovich, CCH Pounder, Daryl Mitchell. Follows an NCIS team that investigates criminal cases involving military personnel in The Big Easy, a city known for its music, entertainment, and decadence." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt3560084/","name":"NCIS: New Orleans","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM3OTk1NTQyNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjU4NDQwMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Follows an NCIS team that investigates criminal cases involving military personnel in The Big Easy, a city known for its music, entertainment, and decadence.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3560084/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"elainecalloway216"},"dateCreated":"2014-04-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Might be a good spin off","reviewBody":"I grew up in New Orleans and I'm an avid NCIS fan, so I was interested to see how they would handle the Crescent City episodes. Overall, I think it did really well. 8 points out of 10.

A few things: 1. In episode 1, there were a few mistakes that those people who are locals could easily notice. A little bit more research would've been better, but the plot/characters/etc. was good.

2. Bakula's ongoing "my brother, my brother" is too much. People in NOLA don't do that, if anything they say "cher" as an affectionate term for friend, so it seemed overdone on the show.

3. A little bit hard to believe in part 2, that a woman would leave a bar to walk in a dark alley alone with someone she had just met. No local would ever do that. 

4. I liked part 2 much more than part 1, because they focused more on places the locals go to and not just the "tourist top 10 spots" like in episode 1. I also loved how they talked about the city and it gets into your DNA. Great and well scripted.

5. Love the actors and think it could be a great series going forward :)","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":16860,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2014-09-23","keywords":"usa,united states,investigation,naval officer,u.s. navy","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000836/","name":"Scott Bakula"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1827376/","name":"Rob Kerkovich"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001634/","name":"CCH Pounder"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0373192/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0113138/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0274041/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0321782/","name":"Gary Glasberg"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"NCIS: New Orleans: The Fourth Season","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1485290009","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzNkZDYwZjEtMWNlZi00Zjg5LWJhYjktYmY0NzY0ODM2NjM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzNkZDYwZjEtMWNlZi00Zjg5LWJhYjktYmY0NzY0ODM2NjM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Promo"}}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 3560084, Title: NCIS: New Orleans, --- Description: NCIS: New Orleans: Created by Gary Glasberg. With Scott Bakula, Rob Kerkovich, CCH Pounder, Daryl Mitchell. Follows an NCIS team that investigates criminal cases involving military personnel in The Big Easy, a city known for its music, entertainment, and decadence." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt3560084/","name":"NCIS: New Orleans","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM3OTk1NTQyNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjU4NDQwMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Follows an NCIS team that investigates criminal cases involving military personnel in The Big Easy, a city known for its music, entertainment, and decadence.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3560084/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"elainecalloway216","dateCreated":"2014-04-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Might be a good spin off","reviewBody":"I grew up in New Orleans and I'm an avid NCIS fan, so I was interested to see how they would handle the Crescent City episodes. Overall, I think it did really well. 8 points out of 10.

A few things: 1. In episode 1, there were a few mistakes that those people who are locals could easily notice. A little bit more research would've been better, but the plot/characters/etc. was good.

2. Bakula's ongoing "my brother, my brother" is too much. People in NOLA don't do that, if anything they say "cher" as an affectionate term for friend, so it seemed overdone on the show.

3. A little bit hard to believe in part 2, that a woman would leave a bar to walk in a dark alley alone with someone she had just met. No local would ever do that. 

4. I liked part 2 much more than part 1, because they focused more on places the locals go to and not just the "tourist top 10 spots" like in episode 1. I also loved how they talked about the city and it gets into your DNA. Great and well scripted.

5. Love the actors and think it could be a great series going forward :)","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":16860,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2014-09-23","keywords":"usa,united states,investigation,naval officer,u.s. navy","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000836/","name":"Scott Bakula","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1827376/","name":"Rob Kerkovich","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001634/","name":"CCH Pounder"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0373192/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0113138/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0274041/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0321782/","name":"Gary Glasberg"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"NCIS: New Orleans: The Fourth Season","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1485290009","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzNkZDYwZjEtMWNlZi00Zjg5LWJhYjktYmY0NzY0ODM2NjM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzNkZDYwZjEtMWNlZi00Zjg5LWJhYjktYmY0NzY0ODM2NjM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Promo"</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 3560084, Title: NCIS: New Orleans, --- Description: NCIS: New Orleans: Created by Gary Glasberg. With Scott Bakula, Rob Kerkovich, CCH Pounder, Daryl Mitchell. Follows an NCIS team that investigates criminal cases involving military personnel in The Big Easy, a city known for its music, entertainment, and decadence." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt3560084/","name":"NCIS: New Orleans","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM3OTk1NTQyNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjU4NDQwMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Follows an NCIS team that investigates criminal cases involving military personnel in The Big Easy, a city known for its music, entertainment, and decadence.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3560084/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"elainecalloway216","dateCreated":"2014-04-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Might be a good spin off","reviewBody":"I grew up in New Orleans and I'm an avid NCIS fan, so I was interested to see how they would handle the Crescent City episodes. Overall, I think it did really well. 8 points out of 10.

A few things: 1. In episode 1, there were a few mistakes that those people who are locals could easily notice. A little bit more research would've been better, but the plot/characters/etc. was good.

2. Bakula's ongoing "my brother, my brother" is too much. People in NOLA don't do that, if anything they say "cher" as an affectionate term for friend, so it seemed overdone on the show.

3. A little bit hard to believe in part 2, that a woman would leave a bar to walk in a dark alley alone with someone she had just met. No local would ever do that. 

4. I liked part 2 much more than part 1, because they focused more on places the locals go to and not just the "tourist top 10 spots" like in episode 1. I also loved how they talked about the city and it gets into your DNA. Great and well scripted.

5. Love the actors and think it could be a great series going forward :)","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":16860,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2014-09-23","keywords":"usa,united states,investigation,naval officer,u.s. navy","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000836/","name":"Scott Bakula","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1827376/","name":"Rob Kerkovich","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001634/","name":"CCH Pounder"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0373192/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0113138/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0274041/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0321782/","name":"Gary Glasberg"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"NCIS: New Orleans: The Fourth Season","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1485290009","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzNkZDYwZjEtMWNlZi00Zjg5LWJhYjktYmY0NzY0ODM2NjM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzNkZDYwZjEtMWNlZi00Zjg5LWJhYjktYmY0NzY0ODM2NjM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Promo"</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 3560084, Title: NCIS: New Orleans, --- Description: NCIS: New Orleans: Created by Gary Glasberg. With Scott Bakula, Rob Kerkovich, CCH Pounder, Daryl Mitchell. Follows an NCIS team that investigates criminal cases involving military personnel in The Big Easy, a city known for its music, entertainment, and decadence." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt3560084/","name":"NCIS: New Orleans","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM3OTk1NTQyNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjU4NDQwMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Follows an NCIS team that investigates criminal cases involving military personnel in The Big Easy, a city known for its music, entertainment, and decadence.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3560084/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"elainecalloway216","dateCreated":"2014-04-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Might be a good spin off","reviewBody":"I grew up in New Orleans and I'm an avid NCIS fan, so I was interested to see how they would handle the Crescent City episodes. Overall, I think it did really well. 8 points out of 10.

A few things: 1. In episode 1, there were a few mistakes that those people who are locals could easily notice. A little bit more research would've been better, but the plot/characters/etc. was good.

2. Bakula's ongoing "my brother, my brother" is too much. People in NOLA don't do that, if anything they say "cher" as an affectionate term for friend, so it seemed overdone on the show.

3. A little bit hard to believe in part 2, that a woman would leave a bar to walk in a dark alley alone with someone she had just met. No local would ever do that. 

4. I liked part 2 much more than part 1, because they focused more on places the locals go to and not just the "tourist top 10 spots" like in episode 1. I also loved how they talked about the city and it gets into your DNA. Great and well scripted.

5. programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
NCIS: New Orleans
Agenci NCIS: Nowy Orlean
NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc:
NCIS: New Orleans: Created by Gary Glasberg. With Scott Bakula, Rob Kerkovich, CCH Pounder, Daryl Mitchell. Follows an NCIS team that investigates criminal cases involving military personnel in The Big Easy, a city known for its music, entertainment, and decadence." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt3560084/","name":"NCIS: New Orleans","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM3OTk1NTQyNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjU4NDQwMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Follows an NCIS team that investigates criminal cases involving military personnel in The Big Easy, a city known for its music, entertainment, and decadence.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3560084/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"elainecalloway216"},"dateCreated":"2014-04-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Might be a good spin off","reviewBody":"I grew up in New Orleans and I'm an avid NCIS fan, so I was interested to see how they would handle the Crescent City episodes. Overall, I think it did really well. 8 points out of 10.

A few things: 1. In episode 1, there were a few mistakes that those people who are locals could easily notice. A little bit more research would've been better, but the plot/characters/etc. was good.

2. Bakula's ongoing "my brother, my brother" is too much. People in NOLA don't do that, if anything they say "cher" as an affectionate term for friend, so it seemed overdone on the show.

3. A little bit hard to believe in part 2, that a woman would leave a bar to walk in a dark alley alone with someone she had just met. No local would ever do that. 

4. I liked part 2 much more than part 1, because they focused more on places the locals go to and not just the "tourist top 10 spots" like in episode 1. I also loved how they talked about the city and it gets into your DNA. Great and well scripted.

5. Love the actors and think it could be a great series going forward :)","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":16860,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2014-09-23","keywords":"usa,united states,investigation,naval officer,u.s. navy","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000836/","name":"Scott Bakula"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1827376/","name":"Rob Kerkovich"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001634/","name":"CCH Pounder"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0373192/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0113138/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0274041/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0321782/","name":"Gary Glasberg"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"NCIS: New Orleans: The Fourth Season","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1485290009","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzNkZDYwZjEtMWNlZi00Zjg5LWJhYjktYmY0NzY0ODM2NjM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzNkZDYwZjEtMWNlZi00Zjg5LWJhYjktYmY0NzY0ODM2NjM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Promo"}}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 3560084, Title: NCIS: New Orleans, --- Description: NCIS: New Orleans: Created by Gary Glasberg. With Scott Bakula, Rob Kerkovich, CCH Pounder, Daryl Mitchell. Follows an NCIS team that investigates criminal cases involving military personnel in The Big Easy, a city known for its music, entertainment, and decadence." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt3560084/","name":"NCIS: New Orleans","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM3OTk1NTQyNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjU4NDQwMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Follows an NCIS team that investigates criminal cases involving military personnel in The Big Easy, a city known for its music, entertainment, and decadence.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3560084/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"elainecalloway216","dateCreated":"2014-04-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Might be a good spin off","reviewBody":"I grew up in New Orleans and I'm an avid NCIS fan, so I was interested to see how they would handle the Crescent City episodes. Overall, I think it did really well. 8 points out of 10.

A few things: 1. In episode 1, there were a few mistakes that those people who are locals could easily notice. A little bit more research would've been better, but the plot/characters/etc. was good.

2. Bakula's ongoing "my brother, my brother" is too much. People in NOLA don't do that, if anything they say "cher" as an affectionate term for friend, so it seemed overdone on the show.

3. A little bit hard to believe in part 2, that a woman would leave a bar to walk in a dark alley alone with someone she had just met. No local would ever do that. 

4. I liked part 2 much more than part 1, because they focused more on places the locals go to and not just the "tourist top 10 spots" like in episode 1. I also loved how they talked about the city and it gets into your DNA. Great and well scripted.

5. Love the actors and think it could be a great series going forward :)","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":16860,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2014-09-23","keywords":"usa,united states,investigation,naval officer,u.s. navy","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000836/","name":"Scott Bakula","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1827376/","name":"Rob Kerkovich","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001634/","name":"CCH Pounder"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0373192/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0113138/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0274041/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0321782/","name":"Gary Glasberg"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"NCIS: New Orleans: The Fourth Season","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1485290009","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzNkZDYwZjEtMWNlZi00Zjg5LWJhYjktYmY0NzY0ODM2NjM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzNkZDYwZjEtMWNlZi00Zjg5LWJhYjktYmY0NzY0ODM2NjM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Promo"</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 3560084, Title: NCIS: New Orleans, --- Description: NCIS: New Orleans: Created by Gary Glasberg. With Scott Bakula, Rob Kerkovich, CCH Pounder, Daryl Mitchell. Follows an NCIS team that investigates criminal cases involving military personnel in The Big Easy, a city known for its music, entertainment, and decadence." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt3560084/","name":"NCIS: New Orleans","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM3OTk1NTQyNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjU4NDQwMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Follows an NCIS team that investigates criminal cases involving military personnel in The Big Easy, a city known for its music, entertainment, and decadence.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3560084/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"elainecalloway216","dateCreated":"2014-04-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Might be a good spin off","reviewBody":"I grew up in New Orleans and I'm an avid NCIS fan, so I was interested to see how they would handle the Crescent City episodes. Overall, I think it did really well. 8 points out of 10.

A few things: 1. In episode 1, there were a few mistakes that those people who are locals could easily notice. A little bit more research would've been better, but the plot/characters/etc. was good.

2. Bakula's ongoing "my brother, my brother" is too much. People in NOLA don't do that, if anything they say "cher" as an affectionate term for friend, so it seemed overdone on the show.

3. A little bit hard to believe in part 2, that a woman would leave a bar to walk in a dark alley alone with someone she had just met. No local would ever do that. 

4. I liked part 2 much more than part 1, because they focused more on places the locals go to and not just the "tourist top 10 spots" like in episode 1. I also loved how they talked about the city and it gets into your DNA. Great and well scripted.

5. Love the actors and think it could be a great series going forward :)","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":16860,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2014-09-23","keywords":"usa,united states,investigation,naval officer,u.s. navy","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000836/","name":"Scott Bakula","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1827376/","name":"Rob Kerkovich","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001634/","name":"CCH Pounder"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0373192/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0113138/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0274041/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0321782/","name":"Gary Glasberg"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"NCIS: New Orleans: The Fourth Season","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1485290009","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzNkZDYwZjEtMWNlZi00Zjg5LWJhYjktYmY0NzY0ODM2NjM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzNkZDYwZjEtMWNlZi00Zjg5LWJhYjktYmY0NzY0ODM2NjM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Promo"</script><metacontent="

Overall, I think it did really well. 8 points out of 10.

A few things: 1. In episode 1, there were a few mistakes that those people who are locals could easily notice. A little bit more research would've been better, but the plot/characters/etc. was good.

2. Bakula's ongoing "my brother, my brother" is too much. People in NOLA don't do that, if anything they say "cher" as an affectionate term for friend, so it seemed overdone on the show.

3. A little bit hard to believe in part 2, that a woman would leave a bar to walk in a dark alley alone with someone she had just met. No local would ever do that. 

4. I liked part 2 much more than part 1, because they focused more on places the locals go to and not just the "tourist top 10 spots" like in episode 1. I also loved how they talked about the city and it gets into your DNA. Great and well scripted.

5. credits.actor: Joanna Kulig, Adam Woronowicz, Alan Tybulczuk, Eryk Remański, Szymon Kuś

programme.title: Mój kraj taki piękny
programme.desc: W Polsce trwa spór pomiędzy dwoma ugrupowaniami - narodowcami i ich przeciwnikami. Grzegorz Paprzycki dokumentuje przebieg tych potyczek. Pojawia się w samym środku wydarzeń, podczas których niejednokrotnie dochodzi do aktów przemocy. Film stanowi subiektywne spojrzenie na konflikt, który toczy się na polskich ulicach. Za swój obraz reżyser otrzymał Złotego Lajkonika na Krakowskim Festiwalu Filmowym.

credits.actor: Jakub Kopeć
Aleksander Krzystyniak
Grzegorz Paprzycki
Rafał Paluszkiewicz
Justyna Koziarz

programme.title: Tamtej nocy
programme.desc: Zuzanna Szwarc (Hanna Konarowska), mama kilkuletniej dziewczynki, pracuje jako kuratorka sztuki. Pewnego wieczoru widzi napad. Dwóch mężczyzna atakuje chłopaka. Zuza nie pozostaje obojętna i stara się go obronić. Kiedy na miejsce przybywa policja, to jednak ona, nie sprawcy pobicia, zostaje aresztowana.

credits.actor: Hanna Konarowska
Piotr Stramowski
Karina Kunkiewicz
Anna Szczerbińska
Marek Serafin
Jan Fabiańczyk
Hanna Samson
Mateusz Halawa
Błażej Żuławski

programme.title: Hi, How Are You
programme.desc: Bezrobotny pięćdziesięcioletni Sławek (Jacek Poniedziałek) ma problem z zabiciem wolnego czasu. Mężczyzna przesiaduje w domu bądź włóczy się po osiedlu, szukając zaginionego kota. W najlepszym razie wykonuje różnego rodzaju prace zlecone mu przez żonę. Pewnego dnia Sławek poznaje tajemniczą sąsiadkę Kamilę (Maja Szopa). Kobieta zaprasza go do swojego ogrodu.

credits.actor: Jacek Poniedziałek
Maja Szopa
Aleksandra Justa
Arkadiusz Brykalski
Monika Kwiatkowska
Witold Dębicki
Jacek Domański

programme.title: We mnie
programme.desc: Sandra (Małgorzata Gorol) świętuje swój wieczór panieński. Zbliża się dzień ślubu, ale przedtem musi poddać się aborcji - płód ma wady genetyczne. Do szpitala jedzie z nią narzeczony. Z każdą kolejną minutą mężczyzna wydaje się Sandrze coraz bardziej obcy. Po zabiegu kobieta postanawia szczerze z nim porozmawiać.

programme.title: Klub piłkarski Nefta
Nefta Football Club
programme.desc: W tunezyjskiej wiosce dzieci grają w piłkę nożną na pustkowiach. Tymczasem Abdallah (Mohamed Ali) i Mohamed (Eltayef Dhaoui) spotykają osła ze słuchawkami na uszach i torbami pełnymi białego proszku na plecach. Dwaj młodzi bracia postanawiają przynieść bagaż do swojej wioski.

programme.title: Qu'est-ce qu'on a encore fait au bon Dieu
I znowu zgrzeszyliśmy, dobry Boże!
Qu'est-ce qu'on a encore fait au bon Dieu?
programme.desc:
Qu'est-ce qu'on a encore fait au bon Dieu?: Directed by Philippe de Chauveron. With Christian Clavier, Chantal Lauby, Ary Abittan, Medi Sadoun. Claude and Marie Verneuil face a new crisis: their four daughters' spouses--David, Rachid, Chao, and Charles--have decided to leave France for various reasons. Here they imagine their lives elsewhere." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6556670/","name":"Qu'est-ce qu'on a encore fait au bon Dieu?","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmQ0MTRiNmUtYTAyYi00NGViLWExYjEtYzQwZWEyZWFmMDQ4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTc5OTMwOTQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"Claude and Marie Verneuil face a new crisis: their four daughters' spouses--David, Rachid, Chao, and Charles--have decided to leave France for various reasons. Here they imagine their lives elsewhere.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6556670/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"georgioskarpouzas"},"dateCreated":"2019-07-24","inLanguage":"English","name":"Treating serious matters in a lighter vein","reviewBody":"Having watched the first movie I decided to give a chance to the second bearing in mind that often the continuation of a successful recipe does not live up to the original movie. This observation was confirmed although the second film is still very funny. I have to admit that it is full of commonplaces and cliches to an annoying degree. The truth is that you laugh and that is the aim of a comedy. There is no originality in the jokes, they are as commonplace and trite as you could imagine but I found myself laughing most of the time.

The plot is simple. The bourgeois elderly couple strives to keep their four daughters in France while the latter under the instigation of their foreign husbands seek to pursue their luck outside their country to destinations linked with the origins of their spouses. The lengths to which the paterfamilias and his wife go to incite their daughters and grooms to remain in France inspire the main comedy effect of the film.

It is important to note that the scenario is very apt concerning current affairs in French society so that anyone closely following developments in French social reality will recognize imediately that important and "heavy" matters dividing national opinion such as immigration, integration and tolerance towards Muslim practices or legalization of homosexual marriage are treated in a lighter vein and produce ample laughter despite their insoluble and often tragic aspects in real life.

I recommend this movie which without being a masterpiece will appeal to those with a vivid interest in the dilemmas of postmodern multicultural society who are ready to put aside for a moment the often tragic connotations of those matters and accept the comic element which is inherent even in the most serious aspects of human social coexistence.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":7096,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.1},"genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2019-01-30","keywords":"sequel,reference to donald trump,burqa,jewish,reference to honore de balzac","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bande-annonce [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi385595929","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNThjODc0ODItN2MyNC00MWVkLWEzZmQtZTQ0MDlhZWVjZTY2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNThjODc0ODItN2MyNC00MWVkLWEzZmQtZTQ0MDlhZWVjZTY2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002010/","name":"Christian Clavier"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0490702/","name":"Chantal Lauby"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2987278/","name":"Ary Abittan"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0154385/","name":"Philippe de Chauveron"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0367060/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0079764/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0718581/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0491230/","name":"Guy Laurent"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0154385/","name":"Philippe de Chauveron"}],"duration":"PT1H39M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Jestem tutaj
programme.desc: Niespodziewany przyjazd młodszego brata Stefana (Miłosz Frydrychowicz) zmusza dwudziestoletnią Hanię (Marianna Kowalewska) do zmierzenia się z trudną przeszłością i do odnowy kontaktu z dawno niewidzianą matką. programme.title: Babyteeth
Zaraza
Ill: Final Contagium
programme.desc:
Babyteeth: Directed by Shannon Murphy. With Eliza Scanlen, Michelle Lotters, Toby Wallace, Sora Wakaki. Milla, a seriously ill teenager, falls in love with a drug dealer, Moses, her parents' worst nightmare." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8399664/","name":"Babyteeth","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMGRhMzRkYzEtMDBjNy00YjkxLWJjNzctNzEwNGNhZDUyZWI0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTE1MzI2NzIz._V1_.jpg","description":"Milla, a seriously ill teenager, falls in love with a drug dealer, Moses, her parents' worst nightmare.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8399664/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"evanston_dad"},"dateCreated":"2020-12-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Well Acted But Very Depressing","reviewBody":"Well acted but very depressing.

Eliza Scanlan gives a fascinating performance as a young woman who's going through cancer treatment and falls for a drug addict who may or may not be good for her. Her parents (Essie Davis and Ben Mendelsohn) are dysfunctional and unraveling and have drug problems of their own. They don't like her daughter's boyfriend and under normal circumstances probably wouldn't tolerate him. But he's the only thing that brings their daughter some respite from the hell she's going through, so they sort of adopt him as their own.

"Babyteeth" is a coming of age movie that's set apart from others like it because of the protagonist's existential crisis. Scanlan's character is as immature in some ways as any sixteen year old, but at the same time is being asked to summon up reserves of maturity to deal with the ultimate curve ball life has to throw at us. How do you balance the emotional and hormonal ups and downs of teen romance with the possibility of your impending death?

The film is a bit monotonous in tone and starts to feel like a grind after a while. But again, it's worth seeing for the performances and for the unsentimental treatment of the subject matter that would have possibly segued into the maudlin in different hands. The ending scene is the most devastating thing I've seen in a movie this year.

Grade: B+","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":14022,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"contentRating":"MA-17","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Music"],"datePublished":"2020-07-23","keywords":"pills,dog,teenage girl loses her hair,teenage girl wears a wig,hospital","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Babyteeth","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi678936601","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzM2ODA5ZDItMjJjMS00ZTYxLTk3ODItOTNiMGEwZGQ2NzNiXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzM2ODA5ZDItMjJjMS00ZTYxLTk3ODItOTNiMGEwZGQ2NzNiXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer 1"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7340546/","name":"Eliza Scanlen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm9334013/","name":"Michelle Lotters"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3108675/","name":"Toby Wallace"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2221724/","name":"Shannon Murphy"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0234956/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0658237/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0017733/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1514808/","name":"Rita Kalnejais"}],"duration":"PT1H58M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Faites sauter la banque
Napad na bank
Faites sauter la banque!
programme.desc: Faites sauter la banque!: Directed by Jean Girault. With Louis de Funès, Yvonne Clech, Jean-Pierre Marielle, Anne Doat. A grouchy shopkeeper made an unsuccessful financial investment, and now he is on the verge of bankruptcy. In order to avenge oneself he engages his own family into a plan to rob a next door bank." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0057051/","name":"Faites sauter la banque!","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjE1NDM2YzUtMjY1OC00NTdkLTg3MWYtOTk2Y2RiMWQ3N2Q5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTgxOTIzNzk@._V1_.jpg","description":"A grouchy shopkeeper made an unsuccessful financial investment, and now he is on the verge of bankruptcy. In order to avenge oneself he engages his own family into a plan to rob a next door bank.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0057051/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"lyubitelfilmov"},"dateCreated":"2021-03-19","inLanguage":"English","name":"Family Robbery or How to Punish a Greedy Banker","reviewBody":"Comedy. I stumbled upon this French comedy purely by accident, then read some reviews, which were already very captivating with the sincerity of emotions and the excellent acting of the comedian Louis de Funes. And I decided to personally check it out - and did not regret this decision, and here is my brief opinion - How to punish a greedy banker. I did not notice the minuses in the picture, although I tried to find them with the zeal of a religious fanatic, so let your humble servant focus your attention on the merits of this comedy. So, here they are: 1. Scenario - Monsieur Garnier, the father of a large family and the owner of the "Hunting and Fishing" store, lived in the world and wanted to invest his savings in a good and "true" business. To do this, he went to the bank opposite his store and, on the advice of the owner of the bank, Monsieur Durand-Marey, invested in a company. As a result, I lost all my money. Driven by righteous anger, well, financial difficulties, he decides to rob, involving the whole family. The picture is a robbery, which means there will be many funny and unusual situations, pleasant humor and charisma of Louis de Funes. Of course, there will be scenario twists and charismatic characters. And the finale will pleasantly surprise you, and make you watch the picture from beginning to end. I myself watched with great pleasure what was happening on the screen. If you love a similar genre of crime comedy: "How to Steal a Million", "Gambit", "Big Jackpot" and so on, then you should not turn away from this comedy! 2. Humor - I must warn you in advance that do not count on wild laughter, but funny situations, funny antics and a lot of palms attached to the head from the bacchanalia taking place on the screen are provided to you. Personally, I hoped to laugh heartily, but I managed to realize this only partially. In the local humor there is no vulgarity, vulgarity, and indeed "dirt", so you can watch the whole family. 3. Music - the famous French composer Paul Mauriat was responsible for it (whose music I just adore and regularly insert into my reviews). Well, here the music is funny, sometimes dramatic, but always light and relaxed, which immerses the viewer in what is happening on the screen. 4. Acting - everyone coped with their roles a little more than completely. It seems to me that the actors not only did their work, but even had time to have fun on the set of this picture. Everyone did a great job and no one raises any complaints. And the characters are quite colorful, although some have nothing in the picture of screen time. A little about the main characters: 1. Victor Garnier, performed by Louis de Funes, is an honest and respected businessman and owner of a small shop who was deceived by his neighbor banker, and now it is time for revenge. Louis de Funes is a cult in France, for and in Russia and the countries of the former USSR too. And if I didn't like the "Gendarme of Saint-Tropez" (for it is boring and not funny), then this is another matter. Almost the whole picture rests on the charisma and antics of Louis. His crazy ideas cause laughter, and their implementation - even more laughter. He perfectly played the role of the father of the family and the leader of the family gang. Bravo Louis! 2. André Durand-Marey performed by Jean-Pierre Mariel - the owner of the bank, who profited from the honesty of Monsieur Garnier and many other people. He does not deny himself anything and boasts of his position and money. Typical "business shark" who rowed everything for himself and only himself. Nevertheless, you will not deny him in mind. Jean-Pierre perfectly played the main villain and scoundrel, whom you despise with all your heart. 3. Philippe Brecy performed by Jean Valmont - a bank employee who fell in love with the daughter of Monsieur Garnier. An honest and humble young man who has a role to play in the upcoming events. Jean was very convincing in this role. This comedy is not a masterpiece, but it deserves a quality four. To while away the evening with her is a great option! As a result, we have a good comedy about a robbery, with a good and strong script, great music, high-quality humor, charismatic characters, and great acting. My rating is 7 out of 10 and my recommendation for viewing!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2128,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"genre":["Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"1964-02-25","keywords":"tough girl,strong female character,four word title,exclamation point in title,male police officer","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000086/","name":"Louis de Funès"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0165915/","name":"Yvonne Clech"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0547339/","name":"Jean-Pierre Marielle"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0320833/","name":"Jean Girault"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0032877/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0010669/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0897505/","name":"Jacques Vilfrid"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0320833/","name":"Jean Girault"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0764583/","name":"Louis Sapin"}],"duration":"PT1H28M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Na strajk!
programme.desc: Dzień z życia 19-letniego Karola, który opiekuje się dziadkiem chorym na alzheimera. Niebawem chłopak poznaje tajemnicę rodzinną związaną z dramatycznymi wydarzeniami podczas stoczniowych strajków w grudniu 1970 roku. Odkryta przeszłość zmusza go do podjęcia najważniejszej decyzji w życiu.

programme.title: The Salisbury Poisonings
The Salisbury Poisonings
Truciciele z Salisbury
The Salisbury Poisonings
programme.desc:
The Salisbury Poisonings: With Rafe Spall, Anne-Marie Duff, Annabel Scholey, Judah Cousin. Three episode, fact based drama from the BBC, about the 2018 Novichok poisoning crisis in the city of Salisbury." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt10394886/","name":"The Salisbury Poisonings","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTFiM2JjMzktZGY0Ny00ODFkLWJlYTEtNTM3N2RlMDE3YmQxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc3MjQzNTI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Three episode, fact based drama from the BBC, about the 2018 Novichok poisoning crisis in the city of Salisbury.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10394886/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"neilleacy"},"dateCreated":"2020-06-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"An insight into what want on behind the headlines.","reviewBody":"I know from local newspaper articles that many people in Salisbury felt that the showing of this docu-drama was too soon after the event. That it would rake over old coals and put our city once again in a bad light. We'll for me it didn't.

For those looking for a hard-hitting insight into how and why the Russians attempted what they did or why the suspects have never been charged then go watch the news specials that came out at the time. But for a view of how the real people at the heart of this whole affair were really affected then the writers, directors and actors have done a good job.

Yes, it is low key in its look and feel. Yes, there are a lot of people who know Salisbury thinking 'that's not somewhere I recognise'; the use of locations from other cathedral cities threw me off the narrative a couple of times wondering where the characters were meant to be. But most importantly it drew me in to understanding more of how just frightening the possible outcome of not having an early intervention could have been and the emotional strain on those key families.

For you 1 star reviewers I say your expectations were skewed from the start. It was good to see what felt like a truthful docu-drama.

And as my son said at the end of part 3, 'well, that was emotional.'","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":4401,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Drama","History","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2020-06-14","keywords":"poisoning,salisbury wiltshire,year 2018,nerve agent,british police","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1245863/","name":"Rafe Spall"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0240359/","name":"Anne-Marie Duff"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2118257/","name":"Annabel Scholey"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0645108/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0043107/"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2779562265","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzNlNGI3NzMtZDRkMC00MjdkLTgwYTUtY2ViZDcwYjJlMDJhXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzNlNGI3NzMtZDRkMC00MjdkLTgwYTUtY2ViZDcwYjJlMDJhXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg","description":"In March 2018, the eyes of the world turned to the British city of Salisbury when it became the epicenter of what has been described as one of the biggest political events of the 21st century -- but until now, the heroic acts behind the headlines have not been told. Within three days of the assassination attempt on double agent and spy Sergei Skripal and his daughter Yulia, key agencies discovered that a lethal nerve agent called Novichok was used, just half a teaspoon of which could kill 20,000 people. Within four days, hundreds of traces were found across the city, and, just when things were finally thought to be under control, a perfume bottle containing the nerve agent was discovered, throwing the investigation into renewed chaos."}}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Wojowniczka
programme.desc: Cykl prezentujący wyselekcjonowany zbiór najlepszych filmów krótkometrażowych. Wiele z nich nagrodzonych zostało prestiżowymi wyróżnieniami na międzynarodowych galach i festiwalach filmowych. Każde pasmo przedstawia kilka produkcji na dany temat.

credits.actor: Tchéky Karyo, Tom Hollander, Anastasia Hille, Alec Secareanu, Anna Próchniak, Barbara Sarafian, Talisa Garcia, Clare Calbraith, Jessica Raine
Tchéky Karyo, Tom Hollander, Anastasia Hille, Alec Secareanu, Anna Próchniak, Barbara Sarafian, Talisa Garcia, Clare Calbraith, Jessica Raine

programme.title: We mnie
programme.desc: Sandra (Małgorzata Gorol) świętuje swój wieczór panieński. Zbliża się dzień ślubu, ale przedtem musi poddać się aborcji - płód ma wady genetyczne. Do szpitala jedzie z nią narzeczony. Z każdą kolejną minutą mężczyzna wydaje się Sandrze coraz bardziej obcy. Po zabiegu kobieta postanawia szczerze z nim porozmawiać.

credits.actor: Małgorzata Gorol
Julian Świeżewski
Dorota Lulka
Krzysztof Stasierowski

programme.title: Mój kraj taki piękny
programme.desc: W Polsce trwa spór pomiędzy dwoma ugrupowaniami - narodowcami i ich przeciwnikami. Grzegorz Paprzycki dokumentuje przebieg tych potyczek. Pojawia się w samym środku wydarzeń, podczas których niejednokrotnie dochodzi do aktów przemocy. Film stanowi subiektywne spojrzenie na konflikt, który toczy się na polskich ulicach. Za swój obraz reżyser otrzymał Złotego Lajkonika na Krakowskim Festiwalu Filmowym.

credits.actor: Jakub Kopeć
Aleksander Krzystyniak
Grzegorz Paprzycki
Rafał Paluszkiewicz
Justyna Koziarz

programme.title: Hi, How Are You
programme.desc: Bezrobotny pięćdziesięcioletni Sławek (Jacek Poniedziałek) ma problem z zabiciem wolnego czasu. Mężczyzna przesiaduje w domu bądź włóczy się po osiedlu, szukając zaginionego kota. W najlepszym razie wykonuje różnego rodzaju prace zlecone mu przez żonę. Pewnego dnia Sławek poznaje tajemniczą sąsiadkę Kamilę (Maja Szopa). Kobieta zaprasza go do swojego ogrodu.

programme.title: Rączki
Les petites mains
programme.desc: Leo (Emile Moulron Lejeune) ma 1,5 roku i jest synem dyrektora zakładu chemicznego. Kiedy zatrudnione tam osoby dowiadują się, że fabryka ma być zamknięta pracownik Bruno (Jan Hammenecker) porywa dziecko, by prowadzić negocjacje.

programme.title: To, co zostaje
programme.desc: Marianna (Marta Ścisłowicz) i Jan (Piotr Czarniecki) wiodą szczęśliwe życie na wsi w północno-wschodniej Polsce. Pewnego dnia kobieta musi stawić czoła niespodziewanej śmierci męża. Wyrzuty sumienia i nagła strata sprawiają, że potrzebuje czasu, żeby pożegnać ukochanego. Zamyka się z jego ciałem w domu. Jej zachowanie spotyka się z niezrozumieniem mieszkańców wioski.

credits.actor: Marta Ścisłowicz
Piotr Czarniecki
Michał Jaros
Elżbieta Studniarek

programme.title: Szalona historia Mela Brooksa
programme.desc: Mistrz filmowej parodii z humorem i pasją opowiada o swojej karierze. Dokumentaliści przypominają osiągnięcia Mela Brooksa. Przedstawiają fragmenty komedii oraz wywiady z współpracownikami reżysera.

Un divan à Tunis
programme.desc: Un divan à Tunis: Directed by Manele Labidi. With Golshifteh Farahani, Majd Mastoura, Aïsha Ben Miled, Feryel Chammari. After years abroad in Paris, Selma returns to Tunis with the dream of opening up her own psychotherapy practice." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9648886/","name":"Un divan à Tunis","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc3MjRhNzctYWQ4OC00Nzg0LWIwMzYtYWVjN2ZmMjUyNTExXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjgzMjQ0MTA@._V1_.jpg","description":"After years abroad in Paris, Selma returns to Tunis with the dream of opening up her own psychotherapy practice.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9648886/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"kosmasp"},"dateCreated":"2021-05-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"On the Couch","reviewBody":"The struggle to become something or someone .. to succeed in ones profession or dream/pursuit. And if you are a woman ... well the struggle can be even worse. Especially in some countries and situations. Not that we have reached real equality anywhere, but in some countries it is even worse than in others, when it comes to women being able to work however they want to.\n\nThat is just the basis, just one of the points the movie is making. Psychologically speaking there is more to it. Great central performance, great persistence, great fight for what she believes in. And really fun and interesting side stories of the ... side characters overall. A nice little movie/drama, that you will like if you are into low budget character studies.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2592,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2020-02-12","keywords":"psychotherapy,breaking taboos,french tunsian writer,arabic,north africa","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bande-annonce [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3883056921","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDcyMGEyMTQtOWMwYS00YzgwLTlhMTctOWVmNDNlZmE0MjA1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDcyMGEyMTQtOWMwYS00YzgwLTlhMTctOWVmNDNlZmE0MjA1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0267042/","name":"Golshifteh Farahani"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7573814/","name":"Majd Mastoura"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm10047959/","name":"Aïsha Ben Miled"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm9957570/","name":"Manele Labidi"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0214005/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0063732/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0028557/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1444949/","name":"Maud Ameline"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm9957570/","name":"Manele Labidi"}],"duration":"PT1H28M"}</script><metacontent="

La Chanson
programme.desc: La chanson: Directed by Tiphaine Raffier. With Victoria Quesnel, Noémie Gantier, Tiphaine Raffier, Caroline Tavernier. Pauline, Barbara and Jessica have been friends since childhood and still live in the same odd town. They have a common plan: they want to win a lookalike contest." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8496414/","name":"La chanson","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzE0YTA3NzEtOTNkNS00YWU1LTg4OTUtMTJiNzg5NTc1N2FhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTUzNjM0NTI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Pauline, Barbara and Jessica have been friends since childhood and still live in the same odd town. programme.title: Un beau voyou
Przebiegły złodziej
Un beau voyou
programme.desc:
Un beau voyou: Directed by Lucas Bernard. With Charles Berling, Swann Arlaud, Jennifer Decker, Jean-Quentin Châtelain. Beffrois aguardaba su jubilación con algo de entusiasmo cuando un ladrón de cuadros captó su atención." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt7458798/","name":"Un beau voyou","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTYwMWU1NGUtYjk5OC00YTFlLTliOTItZTljOWFhNWQ5Y2JiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTc5OTMwOTQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"Beffrois aguardaba su jubilación con algo de entusiasmo cuando un ladrón de cuadros captó su atención.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7458798/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"dbdumonteil"},"dateCreated":"2019-11-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"Tu parles, Charles!","reviewBody":"First effort by Lucas Bernard ,both director and screenwriter;his work as a writer leaves a lot to be desired : his story is complicated instead of complex, full of plot holes ,and it's really difficult to pigeonhole the movie: a detective story? rehersals for retirement?(isn't it a bit ironical for a first work?)A (bland) love story?a depiction of social customs of contemporary times?A gibe at modern art ?A tribute to Arsene Lupin and to Louis Feuillade 's Musidora of the silent era?

It does not make a good movie for all that .In the first part ,every scene seems to be the beginning of the film ,and the cop's investigation ,apart from some good lines such as: "the robberies in museums are risky :try to flog "Mona lisa!";so robbery in the wealthy parvenus's houses is a better job.

Fortunately , there are actors who can save something from the wreckage :an actor who works on stage as well as in the movies ,Charles Berling is one of them ;without him ,I would have yawned my head off all along this bore .In my book,everything rests on his shoulders : wearing a wry smile, often overtaken by events (like the cops in old Arsene Lupin), ill at ease in those galleries of weirdoes (the "invitation") or nouveaux riches (our hero does not have a clue in art),he walks through the film like a tourist , rehearsing for retirement .Too subtle a thespian for the part , he nonetheless succeeds in making us feel his fear of retiring (his "I 'll take care of my grandchildren" does not convince anybody ,even himself ): for that matter ,the very old grandad "they don't know to do with "is an ominous prospect .

He may envy the "beau Voyou" (beautiful lout),his youth and his attractive girlfriend ,but he had the last laugh (the very last picture)."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":294,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6},"genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2019-01-02","keywords":"female nudity,topless female nudity,female full rear nudity,barefoot woman,sex scene","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bande-annonce [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi959429145","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjkyZDA3MTUtODM4Ni00Yjg5LTllOGMtNzUzYTBkMTNhYzFjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjkyZDA3MTUtODM4Ni00Yjg5LTllOGMtNzUzYTBkMTNhYzFjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0075650/","name":"Charles Berling"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0035128/","name":"Swann Arlaud"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0213847/","name":"Jennifer Decker"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1602696/","name":"Lucas Bernard"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0519417/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0044140/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0125554/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1602696/","name":"Lucas Bernard"}],"duration":"PT1H44M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Matthias et Maxime
Matthias i Maxime
Matthias & Maxime
programme.desc: Matthias et Maxime: Directed by Xavier Dolan. With Gabriel D'Almeida Freitas, Xavier Dolan, Pier-Luc Funk, Samuel Gauthier. Hidden feelings come to light and threaten the bond of a group of friends in their late 20s." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8767908/","name":"Matthias et Maxime","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzAxODBiOGQtNjAwZi00ZTZlLTkwMjctODk4NmFkNGU3N2I1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTA3MzQ4MTc0._V1_.jpg","description":"Hidden feelings come to light and threaten the bond of a group of friends in their late 20s.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8767908/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"CinemaSerf"},"dateCreated":"2020-09-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"Smoulders but lacks a spark.","reviewBody":"I was rather disappointed by this effort from Xavier Dolan. Perhaps writing/editting and starring in the film robbed him too much of objectivity when it came to actually watching this bit of a non-story. He portrays "Max", a young French-Canadian man who is about to emigrate to Australia. At a party with his childhood friends, he and handsome best pal Matt (Gabriel D'Almeida Freitas) get lumbered with starring in a video being made by one of their number's pesky younger sister. The scene involved the two of them kissing - something neither had done (as an adult) with a man before. What ensues is a slow, deliberately so, depiction of the complications that this kiss has on their relationship. "Matt" has a long term girlfriend, so his reconciliation with his "new" feelings for his friend take on a different guise from those of the single "Max" who has issues with his recovering addict mother. Sadly, though, too much of those repercussions are presumed on us by the director and not demonstrated to the audience. It doesn't need to be a cheesy traditional romance, nor a sex fest, but we are left to imagine or envisage that they want each other only because we know that's what the film is about - not because we are presented with much tangible, or even implied, sense of desire. Indeed the others in their group more readily flirt and banter than the two in the title. It doesn't have a beginning, middle and end - it just has a middle. A rather interestingly filmed and quite well put together middle, but a middle nonetheless. Certainly worth watching - I think Dolan has something about him - but I wanted more from the characters and the story - as it is I just felt like a rather unsatisfied observer.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":6595,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2019-10-09","keywords":"gay character,friendship,kiss,in love with best friend,mother son relationship","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer [OVS]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi707182105","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWNjNTgxYjYtNzI1OS00MzUwLWE5MTEtMjJhZDZhMTllZDQ0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWNjNTgxYjYtNzI1OS00MzUwLWE5MTEtMjJhZDZhMTllZDQ0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8570499/","name":"Gabriel D'Almeida Freitas"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0230859/","name":"Xavier Dolan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2954178/","name":"Pier-Luc Funk"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0230859/","name":"Xavier Dolan"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0489666/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0053578/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0093053/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0230859/","name":"Xavier Dolan"}],"duration":"PT1H59M"}</script><metacontent="
